name: Hotel Monaco Denver - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: Room was sooooo comfortable and quiet. Loved staying at the Monaco. The city view was fantastic. The location is convenient to downtown shopping and sightseeing. The food and atmosphere at Panzano downstairs...wonderful!
reviews.title: Best in Denver!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is one block off the 16th street pedestrian mall-this is a great location.
reviews.title: friendly staff, good location and great happy hour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was helpful and telling us where to go and how to get to places. The hotel had a Happy Hour which appetizers- they had wine and several specialty drinks. Nice lounge to have the Happy Hour. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: 110% awesome!

reviews.text: As the title implies, we loved this place. The inside is beautiful and clean. The front desk is in the front of the lobby near the door, which is good and bad. The good being it is well out of the lounge area of the lobby, so it is quiet in the lounge area. The bad is that there is not a ton of space in front of the desk, so if a line forms or there are just a lot of people, you have to find different places to stand out of the way. As I said, the lounge area with the fireplace is far enough away from the front desk that you can sit there and not hear the desk conversation. The staff is very nice and very helpful. The room was great. Since pets are allowed, it was kinda cool to see all the people walk in and out with their dogs. Since we did not have a pet, they brought us a goldfish to keep in the room. Just a great hotel in general and would suggest it to anybody.
reviews.title: Nifty Hotel - Terrific Food - Even Better Staff!

reviews.text: This is a Kimpton Hotel - What more is there to say.
reviews.title: Solid performance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three of us stayed here in August and the room was spacious and comfortable. We found the location to be quite central to most of the activities we wanted to partake in while we were in the area one weekend (we live in the foothills outside of Denver) that we stayed in town. I would say it more than beats the competition for its spacious room and contemporary details and generous central lounge/meeting area. Perfect for the group to meet and decide what adventure to head off to next. Luxurious appeal with the extreme price - very comparable to surrounding name brand hotels of similar quality.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel w/ spacious rooms & central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent a week at Hotel Monaco in December. Wow, we got upgraded to a suite on the top floor! Lovely! Spacious, bright and quiet (at least in the bedroom, when we sat in the living room, you could hear a lot of activity in the hallway, which was fine) and the decor was fantastic.
reviews.title: love it!

reviews.text: Everyone at the hotel was helpful and friendly. When our heat went out in our room, they fixed it immediately. And, the hotel restaurant has THE BEST happy hour! Not to mention, the best Bloody Mary I've ever had.
reviews.title: Third stay not as charming

reviews.text: Great value, great location. Can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Cool Random Style but Low Shower Pressure

reviews.text: I stayed at the Monaco Denver three times last year. For my third visit, I decided to take my nephews (ages 9 & 14) for an overnight Christmas break get-a-way. This also marked my first stay as an Inner Circle member.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel in Denver

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I generally LOVE Kimpton properties. It makes me happy to stay in a quality, pet friendly hotel, whether or not I'm traveling with my own pets. I particularly love the Monaco properties. I guess I'm a sucker for the loaner goldfish. This trip was the third time I've stayed at the Denver Monaco. On my first trip, my request for a "quiet" room on a "high" floor was honored and I was duly impressed with the property. On my second trip, my room was much closer to the street and near an elevator. Unfortunately, nothing else was available and I was forced to endure a night of car horns and sirens and drunken wedding guests mistaking my room for their own!! On two separate occassions, someone tried to use their room key card to open my door...scaring the bejeesus out of me and forcing a useless call to the front desk for security. On that stay (late fall '10), it was also COLD. I was staying in one of the last of the unrenovated rooms (to my knowledge, they have all been renovated since)...my duvet was threadbare and the heating system seemed to have 2 settings---icebox or sauna. It was a miserable night. In spite of all that though, my husband and I did reserve a room there again (after assurances from Kimpton about the renovations being complete) for a recent road trip. Thanks to a promo (or perhaps my TA backpack), we received an upgrade to a suite. Unfortunately, the renovations did not include better soundproofing in the windows, nor did they bother to clean the window sills before adding the additional pane of glass...so there were dead flies and dust sealed between the glass that looked impossible to remove. Shameful. We were woken up multiple times by sirens and once by someone with way too much base in their car. As much as I love Kimpton and Monaco properties in particular, I'll be looking for a different place to stay the next time I'm in Denver.
reviews.title: It's not my favorite Kimpton property

reviews.text: This was my second visit to the Hotel Monaco. I love this hotel, because it has a boutique hotel feel. The desk staff were very helpful and gracious. The internet was free and fast. I loved the animal print robes in the room (very unique touch). Each evening there is a small wine and appetizer reception in the lobby. There is coffee and hot chocolate available throughout the day. Because I was a return customer, I was allowed to select some items from the mini-bar.
reviews.title: Fabulous Stay at the Monaco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of my favorite hotels in the US. While the "big chain" hotels are all around, I will continue to choose the Monaco because it feels personal!
reviews.title: Couldn't have picked a better place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found great rates on Hotwire and ended up here. We couldn't have picked a better spot. We were in easy walking distance of most of the things we wanted to do. The evening wine reception was a wonderful touch. The decore was fun and the staff welcoming. I was also impressed with the fact the hotel is very pet friendly. While not a dog person myself, I was amazed at the number of guests who brought theirs. During our stay, I heard no barking and there was no pet odor. Only people enjoying being able to travel with their friend. The only two compaints I have were #1 there was no hair dryer in the room. For the first time in my life I decided to pack light and leave out the hair dryer. (We ended up buying a travel size at the local drug store) and #2 the hors deHoevres (sp?) served with the wine reception were not good. Greasy little fowl of some sort - duck maybe? Maybe another night would have had better food. The thought was nice though!
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife celebrating a special getaway. We had a great time, staff was friendly and Panzaon was excellent. Also got a chance to meet their General Manager during wine hour. He told me about some local options to see and do beyond the usual tourist traps. Was a treat, felt like I was an insider. Apparently lots of the staff have some secret local recommendations, so be sure to ask.
reviews.title: OMG!

reviews.text: Great location, three blocks from the conference center and a 10 minute walk to LoDo, the happening area of Denver. Rooms are large with individualized decor. The nice thing about Kimpton hotels is that you don't get the generic colors of a chain hotel.
reviews.title: The best place to stay in downtown Denver!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are very efficient and professional. I particularly commend the conceirge Logan, who I contacted after I couldn't buy tickets to a concert which sold out in 20 minutes (Adele). He contacted me multiple times over several weeks but was ultimately was unable to get me a ticket in the price range I was willing to pay. When I checked in there was a note in my room apologizing for his inability to get the tickets and wishing me a good stay. I commend Logan and the hotel for remembering this after several months had passed. It is indicative of their attention to guests.
reviews.title: A Pleasant, relaxing stay in Denver

reviews.text: Stay here, you will love it!
reviews.title: Hotel Monaco: Another killer Kimpton

reviews.text: We stayed at The Hotel Monaco in Denver, CO for 3 nights. From the valet, front desk, management, bell hops, maids,and all employees that we met at the hotel were very helpful, friendly and courteous.
reviews.title: Stayed here because the Warwick was full... but wish I'd stayed here the whole time!

reviews.text: We felt very comfortable and at home.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a corner suite for 4 nights. Roomy, stylish, awesome spa-tub big enough for 2.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay, great service makes all the difference

reviews.text: The level of service is what will make this hotel stand out. Genuine smiles, relevant tips for skiing in the region, accomodated our request for late check-out. Staff called to bring up to the room the Iphone I had left in the car before I had even noticed. Not once did the valet staff forget to offer directions. Professional cleaning staff had the good judgment to not rearrange my couple changes every day (I basically wanted the office desk empty for work).
reviews.title: Fabulous stay

reviews.text: Nice ambience during happy hour 5-6pm daily.
reviews.title: Great location, just not enough room.

reviews.text: Panzano is not cheap, but the signature pastas are very good and service, again, spotless.
reviews.title: What a blast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for work in spring 2012. The rooms are lovely, high ceilings, dark and modern furnishings, and plenty of space. The location is in a very walkable area, super close to all the downtown restaurants. I also loved that you can bring your dog children without any additional hassle (though my little one didn't come with me). They have dog treats and accessories to help with an animal stay. The happy hour is lovely. When I return to Denver, I will definitely be staying there.
reviews.title: Downtown Denver's pet friendly hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place. Very old building, very nicely remodeled. Stayed for Valentine's day, brought the dog, had a blast! In-room jacuzzi was excellent! The restaurant food was amazing! I had a great time, highly recommend
reviews.title: V-Day Delight!

reviews.text: We stayed here for New Years and had a wonderful time! We loved seeing all the animals and we got a goldfish delivered to our room! The staff was more than accomodating. A bell hop even got me tea at 3 in the morning! Literally went to 7-11 and brought it to me in the lobby because I had a cold. Such a kind and thoughtful staff and place! Highly recommended for any occasion. Beautiful, clean, nice, fun and all good things to say.
reviews.title: Such a wonderful place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Boutique hotel, very chic, the bed was very comfortable. Love the fresh fruit water in the lobby. we were there for the US pro cycling challenge and everything was within walking distance. My only complaint we were charged for something that we did not eat from the room, like 10 bucks,
reviews.title: spacious room, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband stayed here for business two times (his company has company rates). My husband would send pictures of the interesting, but hip decor. There is a spa attached to the hotel that uses Aveada products, so when you walk in each time you feel like you are walking into a relaxing spa, the smell is wonderful ( if you like the eucalyptus spa smell). The staff is extremely nice and helpful from the moment I pulled up to the curb. The hotel has a food and water dish in the foyer for pups and even bikes you can use. There is a wine tasting every night for and hour with white, red wine and hot cider with or without "spirits. There is also a free chair masseuse ( tipping is appreciated) My husband ate at the hotel restaurant Panzano and really likes it and everyone we spoke to likes it too. The location of the hotel is great, right near the hopping 16th street
reviews.title: My idea of a great hotel

reviews.text: Kimpton hotels are always trendy & chic! Dog friendly as many people travel with pets now. I love the coffee in the lobby in the morning. Staff were polite friendly & helpful. Italian food inside the hotel was great. My only compliant is when check in the valet staff was were a little rude. I arrive with another person in the car. Male driver & female passenger. The windows in the rental car had no tint yet the valet staff never approached the passenger side of the car to open the door or anything. Very rude. As the lady should always be first.
reviews.title: Downtown & Trendy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in mid-January for an anniversary celebration and go attend a special exhibition at the Denver Art Museum. The Monaco is everything I would expect from the wonderful Kimpton chain - comfortable and beautifully decorated lobby and rooms, wine hour, and friendly, competent service. The hotel is also an easy one-block walk from the 16th Street Pedestrian Mall, and only about 8 short blocks from the vibrant LoDo area. This would easily be my first choice for Denver lodging the next time we come here. The hotel restaurant and bar (Panzano) is also outstanding.
reviews.title: A beautiful boutique hotel close to everything downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Monaco for two nights to visit the downtown Denver area prior to a week long ski trip at Beaver Creek. The Monaco was absolutely wonderful with the greatest staff ever! I travel quite a bit; when you experience high quality service, you definitely get spoiled and expect it elsewhere. The Monaco will do this to you, as the hotel staff and doormen were phenomenal.
reviews.title: Great hotel and staff!

reviews.text: The hotel itself is gorgeous with large, expansive clean rooms. The hotel is also within walking distance of the 16th Street Mall and other various downtown attractions. Stay here! You won't regret it!
reviews.title: Home Away from Home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Denver in mid-October for my cousin's Graduation. We stayed here because I was so impressed with how my dogs were treated when we stayed in another Hotel Monaco in Salt Lake City, UT. Ever since then, I've been a loyal fan of Kimpton Hotels.
reviews.title: Lovely all the way

reviews.text: So I thought it would only be appropriate to stay at Hotel Monaco. The decor was very inviting. The receptionists were very welcoming. I also asked for a goldfish for our room to keep us company while our puppies stayed home and they delivered asap. The hotel also provides Wine Social at 5pm everyday! It's a great way to meet other guests and locals in the area. The hotel is also a walking distance to all the downtown shops. The location is very convenient to the free shuttle. We will definitely stay here again... Love this place!
reviews.title: A cozy downtown property

reviews.text: friendly service, good food , very comfortable rooms, great location
reviews.title: we loved it and we'll be back

reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Hotel Monaco and I find this hotel to be the best in Denver. The location is as good as it gets (17th and Champa) and still offers a great value. The service is purely 5 star and also the best in the city. The hotel offers a cocktail hour in the evening and coffee and tea in the morning. I will continue to stay at Hotel Monaco on every return to Denver, other than the Hyatt franchise, nothing is close downtown.
reviews.title: Best in Denver!

reviews.text: Note: Adequate gym is located on the second floor and Panzano restaurant is next to the lobby.
reviews.title: Great service and convenient location

reviews.text: Stayed two nights here with my partner for a conference at the hotel. Staff was outstanding - courteous and helpful. Location is great, just a block from the 16th street pedestrian mall with the free bus service. Rooms were well appointed and clean.
reviews.title: Another great kimpton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They welcome animals, which is great, but some guests were letting their dog bark in the hallway at 11pm when we were trying to sleep, so they got a piece of our mind about that. That was bad behavior from the guest though, no fault of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Suite! interesting staff...

description: The newly renovated Hotel Monaco in downtown Denver provides an eclectic luxury hotel experience inviting guests to experience an "Urban Adventure.” It captures the city’s history and adventure with the restoration of two Colorado landmark buildings. This boutique hotel, with adjacent award winning Northern Italian Panzano Restaurant and refreshing Veda Spa and Salon, is within easy walking distance of shopping, nightlife, 16th Street Mall, LoDo, Larimer Square, multiple sporting venues and the Colorado Convention Center.
